8 mnes: Cineas was a Thessalian by birth, and in his youth had heard the eloquence oi Demosthenes (died rao. 322); he must, therefore, have been part middle age when be came with Pyrrhus to Italy. He wasa man oi learning and wisdom, and had much influence in the affairs oi Pyrrhus, so that much oi the latter’s success as well as his moderate methods may be attributed to Cineas’ good counsel. Aiter Heraclea in 282 Cineas, going as ambassador to Rome, nearly persuaded the Sen- ate to accept his proposals.
